alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Sitka (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 15 at 1:37AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM AKDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following area, Eastern Gulf Coast. * WHEN...Until 730 AM AKDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Possible isolated landslides in areas of steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 137 AM AKDT, satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate heavy rain across the advisory area. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding, especially near the Indian River. Between 0.75 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sitka. - For Indian River at Sitka: At 1:15am the stage was 23.65 feet. Flood Stage is 25.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 21.96 feet is expected around 2:00am Saturday. - For Sawmill Creek near Sitka: At 12:30am the stage was 15.37 feet. - For Starrigavan Creek near Sitka: At 12:00am the stage was 12.9 feet. - For Sawmill Creek Below Upper Tailrace Near Sitka: At 12:00am the stage was 5.47 feet. - All residents on or near mountain slopes should be prepared for possible landslides.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
